Package UseCase

Class EventManager

java.lang.Object
UseCase.EventManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class EventManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Manages all the events for the program. Calls methods in Event or Room or RoomManager.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String rmNum, java.lang.String speakerUserName)
      Create an Event object based on the parameters and add it into the list of allEvents variable.
      Parameters:
      title - the title for the event
      date - the date for the event (YYYYMMDD)
      startTime - the start time for the event (HH:mm:ss)
      rmNum - the room number for the event
      speakerUserName - the name of the speaker for the event

    • parseStringToLocalDateTime

      public java.util.List<java.time.LocalDateTime> parseStringToLocalDateTime​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String startTime)
      Returns a list of 2 LocalDateTime object re presenting the start time and end time of a potential event (endTime will automatically be 1 hour after startTime)
      Parameters:
      date - the date for the potential event (YYYYMMDD)
      startTime - the start time for the event (HH:mm:ss)
      Returns:
      a list of LocalDateTime objects parsed from the date and startTime parameters

    • parseStringToLocalDate

      public boolean parseStringToLocalDate​(java.lang.String date)
      Returns whether the given date is a valid date written in the form "YYYYMMDD"
      Parameters:
      date - the date for the potential event (YYYYMMDD)
      Returns:
      true iff the date is a valid date written in the correct format

    • parseStringToLocalTime

      public boolean parseStringToLocalTime​(java.lang.String time)
      Returns whether the given time is a valid time written in the form "HH:MM:SS"
      Parameters:
      time - the time for the potential event (HH:MM:SS)
      Returns:
      true iff the time is a valid time written in the correct format

    • isTimeAvailable

      public boolean isTimeAvailable​(java.lang.String startTime)
      Returns whether or not the given start time is between 9am and 4pm
      Parameters:
      startTime - the start time for the potential event (HH:mm:ss)
      Returns:
      true iff the time is within 9am to 4pm

    • isRoomAvailableAtTime

      public boolean isRoomAvailableAtTime​(java.lang.String roomNum, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String startTime)
      Returns whether or not the given room is booked at the given date and time
      Parameters:
      roomNum - the room number for the potential event
      date - the date for the potential event (YYYYMMDD)
      startTime - the start time for the potential event (HH:mm:ss)
      Returns:
      true iff the room given is not booked by another event at the same time

    • isSpeakerAvailableAtTime

      public boolean isSpeakerAvailableAtTime​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String speakerUserName)
      Returns whether or not the given speaker is already hosting an event at the given date and time
      Parameters:
      date - the date for the potential event (YYYYMMDD)
      startTime - the start time for the potential event (HH:mm:ss)
      speakerUserName - the username for the speaker of the event
      Returns:
      true iff the speaker is not booked for any other event at give date and time

    • isEventTitleUnique

      public boolean isEventTitleUnique​(java.lang.String title)
      Returns whether or not the given event title is unique
      Parameters:
      title - the date for the potential event (YYYYMMDD)
      Returns:
      true iff the given event title has not been created before

    • isEventExist

      public boolean isEventExist​(java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Returns whether or not the event exists
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - the event title that we want to check
      Returns:
      true iff the event with the corresponding event title is in the allEvents list

    • isAttendeeAdded

      public boolean isAttendeeAdded​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Returns whether or not the username of this attendee is in attendeeList of this event
      Parameters:
      userName - the username of the attendee that we want to check
      eventTitle - the event title that we want to check if the attendee is in
      Returns:
      true iff the username of this attendee is in attendeeList of this event

    • canAddAttendee

      public boolean canAddAttendee​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Returns whether or not we can add the username of this attendee to the attendeeList of this event, calls the above helper methods (isEventExist isAttendeeAdded roomNotFull)
      Parameters:
      userName - the username of the attendee that we want to add
      eventTitle - the event title that we want to check if we can add this attendee
      Returns:
      true iff we can add the username of this attendee to the attendeeList of this event

    • canDeleteAttendee

      public boolean canDeleteAttendee​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Returns whether or not we can delete the username of this attendee from the attendeeList of this event, calls the above helper methods (isEventExist isAttendeeAdded)
      Parameters:
      userName - the username of the attendee that we want to delete
      eventTitle - the event title that we want to check if we can delete this attendee
      Returns:
      true iff we can delete the username of this attendee from the attendeeList of this event

    • roomNotFull

      public boolean roomNotFull​(java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Returns whether or not the room of this event is full
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - the event title that we want to check
      Returns:
      true iff the room is not full

    • addAttendee

      public void addAttendee​(java.lang.String attendeeUserName, java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Add attendee to the attendeelist stored in Event
      Parameters:
      attendeeUserName - the username of attendee that is added to the attendeeList
      eventTitle - the event that this attendee sign up to

    • deleteAttendee

      public void deleteAttendee​(java.lang.String attendeeUserName, java.lang.String eventTitle)
      Delete attendee from the attendeeList stored in Event
      Parameters:
      attendeeUserName - the username of attendee that is is deleted from the attendeeList
      eventTitle - the event that this attendee want to cancel spot from

    • getAllEventTitle

      Get a list of all the event titles that are scheduled
      Returns:
      a list of all the event titles that are booked

      Get a string representation for the given event title
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - the title for the event
      Returns:
      a string with the details about the event with given event title
